result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for ZACHARY C MALLON
Current: 55 N Pioneer Parkway, Fond du Lac, WI 54935 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2022)

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
Status hearing on November 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

11:35 AM Defendant ZACHARY C MALLON in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Court questions defendant if he'd like to proceed to the prelim without an attorney or if he'd like to waive the time limits to have counsel present. Defendant states he'd like to waive the prelim. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Defendant waives right to counsel. Court accepts waiver. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. Court cancels the preliminary hearing.

State files an information with the court and states it mirrors the criminal complaint. Court goes over penalties with the defendant.. Defendant enters a plea of Not Guilty. Court will set for Status Hearing November 29, 2022 at 1:45 PM.


Court adjourned at 11:41 PM.
Preliminary hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on November 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

1:12 PM Defendant ZACHARY C MALLON appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Scott Nelson appeared by video for the defendant. Attorney Matthew Steven McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has  no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Nelson states defendant qualifies for the public defender. Atty Nelson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing November 7, 2022 at 2:30 PM. Status of Prelim November 1, 2022 at 11:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:15 PM.
